q: on a 2012 presidential run, Indiana 6th District Rep. Mike Pence , a Republican, said he enjoys public service so much that he would rather run for an office he stands a stronger chance of winning. Our decision, honestly, did come down to the difference between opportunities to seek and opportunities to serve, he said Friday morning on his way in to a town hall meeting with about 50 constituents in this central Indiana town. to Be Rude, But...'' in which he laid down five important principles that actors can use when auditioning. 1. Don't grovel when you come in. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2.
